page.title: 18TOURISM IN MITCHELDEAN
page.content: Mitcheldean and Drybrook are in the Wyedean tourist area. Although there are none of the major tourist attractions for which the Wye Valley and Forest of Dean are well known, the area has some very beautiful hill country, and there are a few places where provisions have been made for tourists. The most important is at the top of Plump Hill, where a derelict area around an old quarry is being landscaped and reseeded, and provided with parking and picnic areas. It is hoped that this will remove some of the pressure from the nearby nature reserves around the ponds. The Wilderness Countryside Trail also starts in this area. Mitcheldean has a fine church, a tiny town hall, and some interesting old houses, but the Youth Hostel was demolished to widen part of the High Street in 1984.
